result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander W Gallas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexander W Gallas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexander W Gallas was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1 consecutive to current sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  

Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Transcript: Plea & Sentencing    1/15/2015    Terri Knowles

ADDRESS INFO for Alexander W Gallas
Current: 10412 N. Magnolia Dr., Mequon, WI 53092 United States  (Effective: 05-07-2015)
Prior: 215 W Falls Rd, Grafton, WI 53024

Defendant Alexander W Gallas in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence.  Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Alexander W Gallas in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Stansbury states case is prepared for disposition on next court date. State will prepare order to produce.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Clerk made arrangements for defendant to appear by video from Fox Lake Correctional
Clerk is informed defendant is no longer at Dodge Correctional, transferred to Fox Lake Correctional. Video to be arranged.
Further proceedings on December 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Alexander W Gallas in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody from Dodge Correctional by video conference. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Stansbury stated there may be information needed from the crime lab.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 01:15 pm. Atty. Stansbury to notify the court if defendant needs to be produced for the next hearing.
Further proceedings on October 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Alexander W Gallas in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody, appears by video from Dodge Correctional Institution. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Stansbury states he has reviewed some discovery, has received more discovery. Aty. Stansbury to notify the court if defendant will appear by video or order to produce for next court hearing.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Alexander W Gallas in court with attorney Robert Douglas Stansbury.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant, accepts waiver and binds case over for trial. State files information, defendant waives reading and enters not guilty plea to Ct. 1 & 2. Court orders $1000 signature bond. Order to produce will be prepared if defendant needs to be produced for next hearing otherwise he will appear by video conference.
